pages.text: Miniature Schnauzers only have one gene that has been witnessed to affect how they look, and this is the D Locus. The D Locus is a dilution that lightens the fur, which can create either silver markings or a gray coat with silver markings.

The D Locus has two potential alleles, the incompletely dominant 'D' and 'd'. The 'D' allele does not affect the coat's color, while the 'd' allele is a dilute that creates lighter fur. Dogs with two copies of 'D' will have black fur, while dogs with two copies of 'b' will have gray fur with silver markings. Dogs with one copy of each will have primarily-black fur but feature silver markings.
pages.title: D Locus
